text.text_translated:
The talk was very interesting. The speaker said some true things. For example, she talked about parents. She talked about what children learn from them.

Teenagers see their parents do things. They see them use social media when they cook. Or they see them use it at a red light. So, teenagers also text when they do their homework. We cannot be surprised by this.

She also said another true thing. People want to be in many places at the same time. So they change between talking in real life and talking online. I see this with my daughter and her friends. They plan to meet. Then they sit together. But they do not talk. Each person talks to someone different online.

feedback.feedback:
PASS: The output is a model example of A2 simplification and adheres to all protocol requirements.

- Factual Integrity: The text is factually correct and accurately reflects the core message of the original text.
- Meaning and Fidelity: The MeaningBERT score of 0.7969 and BERTScore of 0.9095 are both above the required thresholds, indicating excellent preservation of meaning and key phrasing.
- CEFR Compliance: The CEFR classifier correctly identified the text as A2.
- Qualitative Audit: The text demonstrates perfect adherence to A2 standards. Vocabulary is strictly limited to the A1 and A2 levels. Sentence structures are short, simple, and use appropriate A2-level connectors ('So', 'But', 'Or'). Complex ideas from the original text were successfully rephrased into simple, understandable concepts. No deviations were found.

best_attempt.text_translated:
The talk was very interesting. The speaker said some true things. For example, she talked about parents. She talked about what children learn from them.

Teenagers see their parents do things. They see them use social media when they cook. Or they see them use it at a red light. So, teenagers also text when they do their homework. We cannot be surprised by this.

She also said another true thing. People want to be in many places at the same time. So they change between talking in real life and talking online. I see this with my daughter and her friends. They plan to meet. Then they sit together. But they do not talk. Each person talks to someone different online.
